thread.title: X Factor's Reggie N Bollie axed from Simon Cowell's Syco record label after just two single releases
thread.title_full: X Factor's Reggie N Bollie axed from Simon Cowell's Syco record label after just two single releases

author: Zoe Shenton
title: X Factor's Reggie N Bollie axed from Simon Cowell's Syco record label after just two single releases
text:
X Factor's Reggie N Bollie axed from Simon Cowell's Syco record label after just two single releases The duo announced they will continue to make music independently Share Axed: Reggie 'N' Bollie (Photo: Copyright unknown) Share   
The X Factor's Reggie 'N' Bollie have been axed from Simon Cowell 's Syco record label. 
The duo only signed to Syco a month after finishing as runners-up to Louisa Johnson in the 2015 final. 
The pair released two singles under the label, with their second release failing to make an impact. 
The label made the decision because the pair "struggled to turn their support into record sales," reports The Sun. The X Factor Series Finals, London, United Kingdom - 13 December 2015 (Photo: Syco/Thames/Corbis/Dymond) The X Factor Series Finals, London, United Kingdom - 13 December 2015 (Photo: Syco/Thames/Corbis/Dymond) 
A source told the newspaper: “They have worked really hard for the last year but their relationship with Syco didn’t work out and they wanted different things. 
“Their music was very poppy and chart-focused but now they want to focus on a different style. 
Confirming the news, a Syco spokesperson said: "Reggie 'n' Bollie are no longer working with us. We wish the guys the best of luck for the future." 
They also took to Twitter to say they're not fazed by getting the chop. 
"We're finally independend n it feels f**king right #WeCallOurOwnShots #HappyNewMonth2Uall," they tweeted.
